bill.title: Liquor Commission; Liquor License; Public Hearing; Public Notice
bill.description: For counties with a population of five hundred thousand or more: requires a public hearing before the liquor commission on an application for a liquor license to be held not less than thirty days after the first public notice for the hearing.

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Introduced.
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 02-24-15 1:15PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PSM were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Baker, Keith-Agaran, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Galuteria.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 570) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading.
One Day Notice 03-06-15.
Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Kouchi). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 41).
Pass First Reading
Referred to EDB, CPC, JUD, referral sheet 30
Bill scheduled to be heard by EDB on Tuesday, 03-17-15 9:00AM in House conference room 312.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on EDB recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 14 Ayes: Representative(s) Kawakami, Kong, Brower, Cachola, Choy, DeCoite, Ito, Ohno, Onishi, Tokioka, Tsuji, Woodson, Matsumoto, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and Excused: none.
Reported from EDB (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 956), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to CPC.
Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Kawakami, LoPresti, Luke, Saiki excused (4).
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Monday, 03-23-15 2:45PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org
The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 03-25-15.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Wednesday, 03-25-15 2:40PM in conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 16 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Woodson, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Har, Hashem, Kawakami, C. Lee, Nakashima, Oshiro, San Buenaventura, Takayama, Yamane, Fukumoto Chang, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and Excused: none.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1220), recommending referral to JUD.
Report adopted; referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Choy, Ing, Lowen, Luke, McKelvey, Pouha excused (6).
Carried over to 2016 Regular Session.
